page.title: 12Comin Garn Goch
page.content: Today{Comin Garn Goch}is an area of marshy fields.A small convalescent hospital stands there.Many years ago it was the scene of a bloody battle when the Welsh defeated the Normans. Many soldiers are said to have been killed in this fierce battle.Comin Garn Goch meaning Common of Red Stones,tells us something of the carnage which took place there. Local tradition says that the blood was up to the horses' fetlocks. The area also has other historical interests; some remains of the Beaker People were found by{Sir John {Llewellyn}on an archaeological dig in{ {1855.}It is also the site of an old Roman Camp.However,if you go to Comin Garn Goch today, it is very difficult to find any of these remains,but there is a red tint on the stones.
